column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cd696e64dfe8821fe13d959dd2d1a2ee892f9155 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
Can we just delete this? Why was it there in the first place?\n
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/2855\nIt was probably a historical hack to workaround this build failure.  It does appear it can be removed now.\n
As I compile on Windows and am not missing it I guess yes, it is safe. It's also only used in places guarded by `#ifndef WIN32`.\n
I added it back in the day to compile on MSVC. But even if someone were to repeat such a horrific thing, it's indeed not needed anymore as pid_t is only used in areas delimited by #ifdef WIN32.\n
